trial_identification.studytitle: Prospective Registry on User Experience With The Mapping System For Ablation Procedures
trial_identification.scientifictitle: Prospective Registry on User Experience With The Mapping System For Ablation Procedures

interventions.interventions:
Treatment: devices - Rhythmia mapping system Treatment: devices - IntellaMap Orion mapping catheter
Treatment: devices: Rhythmia mapping system A 3-D Cardiac Mapping system
Treatment: devices: IntellaMap Orion mapping catheter A diagnostic basket mapping catheter

primaryOutcome.outcome: Acute Procedural Success - Primary endpoint is the acute procedural success for the primary arrhythmia in the whole cohort of ablation procedures. A procedure will be defined successful if all the following conditions will occur during the case: 1) ability to map, 2) completion of the necessary ablation applications, 3) primary arrhythmia termination (when applicable), and 4) validation of ablation through appropriate technique(s).
primaryOutcome.timepoint: At the end of the index procedure (Day 0)

ethicsAndSummary.summary: This is an observational, prospective, non-randomized, multicenter, post approval study being conducted in the United States, Europe and Asia-Pacific Regions.
